title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when choosing SWT.MULTI
description: When using the SWT example ControlExample, under the Text tab, there is a bug where the ControlExampleText component emits a beep sound when the user selects the SWT.MULTI style. This behavior seems incorrect and should be fixed.
OB: When selecting the SWT.MULTI style in the ControlExampleText component, the application emits a beep sound.
EB: The ControlExampleText component should not emit a beep sound when selecting the SWT.MULTI style.
SR:
1. Open the SWT example ControlExample.
2. Navigate to the Text tab.
3. Click on the Styles button.
4. Select the SWT.SINGLE style.
5. Click back on the Styles button.
6. Select the SWT.MULTI style.
7. Observe if a beep sound is emitted.

Please note that this issue was encountered in build F1 (20020521) on Win2K, but it's not clear if this is specific to SWT or just the SWT Example.
